line.en: It's still dark outside my window.
My alarm isn't ringing either.
Even so, I managed to wake up on my own..
'[Unnhh...]'
This feeling's already familiar.
This often happened the day before a\ncompetition...
Outside, the eastern sky still hasn't begun to\nget any brighter.
Umm... It's Ageha's turn, so she should be awake\nby now.
If she's not, I'll give her an ear-bashing.
'[Oh, there she is.]'
'[Whoa?!]'
'[Oh no, did I startle you? Sorry, sorry.]'
I say as Ageha looks at me, she opens her eyes\neven wider\\
'[EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!]'
'[Whooooooaaaaaahhh!!]'
Her reaction bewildered me.
'[Wh-why?! Why are you here, Aoi?]'
'[Why? Because I'm awake.]'
'[Well, I kind of felt tense so I opened my\neyes.]'
'[This happens a lot before competitions. I try\nto stay calm, but I'm really always anxious.]'
'[Oh... Really?]'
'[What's wrong?]'
'[Nothing... You didn't hear, did you?]'
'[Hmm? Were you humming a song or something?]'
'[No, if you didn't hear, then it's fine.]'
'[What are you talking about?]'
'[As I said, it's no big deal. It's nothing that\nwould have been a problem had you heard it!]'
What the hell is going on?
I've only just gotten up, and my brain isn't\nreally working yet, so I can't find the energy to\ncontinue asking about it.
'[So, how's the sky?]'
'[Right now, it doesn't look like it's going to\nhappen.]'
'[Yeah, seems like it.]'
I knew as soon as I came outside.
It's dawn, so the breeze is cool but it's not as\ncold as the temperature in the readings.
There's hardly any wind even.
On a side of the sky... well, actually the whole\nthing is filled wih stars.
'[It's pretty... Isn't it?]'
'[Sure is.]'
To say that the sky is pretty only means that it\nlooks like the phenomenon we were hoping for\nwon't occur.
'[Seems like it's no good.]'
'[Don't say that.]'
'[Yeah, sorry.]'
It's taboo to talk about losing before a\ncompetition. She shouldn't have to tell me that/
'...Even so...'
Because of the time, the position of the\ntwinkling stars are quite different.

The so-called summer constellations are
disappearing into the west. The ones in the sky
now are the fall constellations, the Great Square
of Pegasus and the W-Shaped Cassiopeia for
example.
Maybe on the eastern horizon, the winter\nconstellation of Orion would just be peeking out.
'[It's strange to think that these stars would be\ncoming out as we sleep.]'
'[That's true.]'
Her eyes sparkle as she looks up at the stars.
Perhaps I'm making the same face as her.
'[It's really mysterious.]'
'[What is?]'
'[This and that, lots of things.]'
'[The stars in the sky, to be here looking at\nthem at this time, being in this place, with Aoi,\neverything.]'
'[I see what you mean...]'
'[How would we tell our past selves that we would\nend up at the 'Witch's Mansion', looking at the\nstars at dawn, so that we can fly a glider?]'
'[Our past selves wouldn't believe it.]'
'[They wouldn't, would they?]'
Back then, we were afraid of this place.

We would play at the secret base, and when we got
tired from playing, we'd go to the old shopping
district and eat ramen at Taiyouken, then go home
and collapse in our bed...]
We can't go back to those nostalgic days.
'[Yeah... I mean, I moved away, came back five\nyears later, got a job at the 'Witch's Mansion',\nand flew a glider at dawn...]'
'[When I say it like that, it seems so\nunbelievable.]'
'[Haha, I've got to thank you, Aoi.]'
'[Yeah, for coming back and becoming the dorm\nmother of this place...]'
'[Because of that, we got to know Amane and got\ninvolved with the glider.]'
'[If that hadn't happened, I would've stayed at\nthe 'Robot Club' and would've been for the\ncontest.]'
'[Did I do something wrong?]'
'[Not at all.]'
'[I've been enjoying myself so much. That's why\nI'm thanking you, Aoi.]'
Ageha made a lovely face as she smiled. Even at\nthis hour, I can see it clearly.
She looked back up at the starry sky.
I traced the lines of her chin and neck.
It's so different from before... Now, she's\nreally so feminine.
But there are still traces of the past... I need\nto tell her about how I feel.
N-no.
I panic, raising my head.
I look at the starry sky above.
'[...The thing that An-chan made is flying\nthrough space.]'
'[Yeah. It's incredible, isn't it?]'
'[When I heard about it, I really liked the sound\nof it.]'
'[You mean the glider?]'
'[Yeah.]'

'[To think that something you've made yourself
can go to such amazing places and see such
amazing things that no one before has ever
seen.]'
'[I think that's the coolest thing ever.]'
'[I know, right.]'
I glance towards the eastern sky.
Apparently, at this hour, it's possible to see\nsatellites which are illuminated by the sunlight\nwith the naked eye.
That's where the parts that An-chan would be\nflying through in space...
It really is pretty damn cool.
'[...We want to fly too, to a sky that no one's\never seen.]'
'(You can do it. I'm sure of it.]'
'[That'd be great.]'
We stand beside each other, looking over the\neastern sky.
It seems like it's going over a slight purple\nhue.
'[...It's not coming, is it?]'
As always, there are no clouds, and it doesn't\nlook like the 'Morning Glory' would occur.
Even so, we're creating other kinds of memories,\nas continue to look at the sky of dawn...]
